column42: '1st) except the possession is permanent. A host body possessed by a conqueror worm in this way undergoes terrible changes to its physiology. Every day
column43: the host must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or take 1d6 points of Charisma drain. Over time
column44: the host slowly grows more wormlike in appearance
column47: and taking on a pale yellow-white coloration. When the host’s Charisma score is drained to 0
column48: an ectoplasmic cocoon forms around the creature. Over the course of the next 24 hours
column49: the host grows to an enormous size
column50: and at the end of this time emerges in a brand new body as a new conqueror worm that retains the memories of its previous incarnation
column51: at which point the host creature is effectively dead (and can be resurrected normally). If the host is slain before this transformation completes
column52: the conqueror worm dies as well. The effect can also be ended by any effect that successfully expels the conqueror worm’s possessing spirit from the host. This is a mind-affecting effect. The save DCs are Charisma-based.']#['Init +1']#['Speed 60 ft.
